string.text: Greetings, brother! Glory to the Monolith!
Greetings to you too! Do you have business with me?

Brother, the Leader awaits you. He will tell you about our rules and commandments. Listen to him and delve into everything. Here, take this, it is prepared specially for you: weapons and equipment. May the power of the Monolith be with you!
Thank you. I'm coming, brother.
Mentor, I need to repair something. %c[orange][Repair]
Indeed. Our enemies do not sleep. Let me see.
Repair the primary weapon.
Repair the secondary weapon.
Repair the armor.
Mentor, I don't have enough money.
Here is your weapon, brother. Let our enemies tremble.
Armor patched up. Glory to the Monolith! To the spite of our enemies, another brother is ready to defend our truth.
Thank you, Mentor.
I am ready to carry faith and truth to those deaf and blind ones again. Glory to the Monolith!
Mentor, there is something else.
Oh, you took quite a beating! Let me have a look:
Hello, Mentor.
Greetings, brother! It is good that you came. You have been with us recently, so I want to give you some instructions.
I am all ears, Mentor.

Like anyone who has stepped onto the true path, you must work. Killing the infidels is the duty of everyone who is with us. But still, the community must live. We need, like everyone else, food, water, medicine, ammo, and so on. To get all this, we need artifacts. The Big World, alas, is not with us. Chaos and disbelief reign there. They are ready to sell anything to anyone, but they need the spawn of the Zone - artifacts. Every member of the community is obliged to bring artifacts they find. For them, this brother will receive a ration consisting of ammo, food, and medkits. The better the artifact, the better the ration.
Greetings, Mentor. %c[orange][Barter]
Come closer, my brother. I am listening to you.
I understand, Mentor, I will try my best.
Mentor. I brought something, take a look.
Artifacts?
I have a "Stone Flower".
I have a "Stone Blood".
I have a "Night Star".
I have a "Soul".
I have a "Spring".
I have a "Crystal".
I have a "Goldfish".
I have a "Meat Chunk".
I have a "Gravi".
Oh, forgive me Mentor, I was mistaken.
Not much... Well, here are three packs of ammo for the Kalash, standard, one medkit, and one antirad.
You work poorly. But okay, take two standard medkits.
O-o-oh, "Night Star"! Let me look at it... An infrequent guest with us. Well done, here is ammo: five packs of armor-piercing for the Groza, two scientific medkits, and two antirads.
A rare artifact, you earned a reward! Here, NATO ammo, five packs, improved, plus three scientific medkits.
No one has brought a "Spring" for a long time. Here, five packs of armor-piercing for the SVU, plus two antirads.
You brought a "Crystal"? You pleased me! Take five packs of ammo for the Val, no, not armor-piercing - standard. But instead, here are two more army medkits.
For the "Goldfish" you are entitled to this: ammo for the Kalash, armor-piercing, five packs, plus two army medkits. Yes, and also canned meat. Take four cans.
For "Meat Chunk" I will give You ammo for the Kalash, three boxes, standard, plus simple medkits and four sticks of sausage.
For "Gravi", here is NATO ammo, three packs, standard, plus two simple medkits and four sticks of sausage.
Glory to the Monolith!

Glory to the Monolith! Greetings to our new brother! As you already know, we have only recently controlled the Sarcophagus territory. After the accident, there wasn't a single person here besides us, only monsters. So, too many of them have bred. Here is your first task: below us, on the territory of the Sarcophagus, a family of burers has settled in, about 5-6 of them. We don't need such neighbors. Therefore, soldier, listen to the order: go there and clear the territory. Also, these creatures stole a device from us - a Decoder, which we really need. Therefore, soldier, besides destroying these dwarfs, you also need to find the Decoder. Dig through all their burrows, but find the device.
I will gladly fulfill this task, Leader. I will not let you down.
Greetings, Leader!
Oh, our new brother. Did you complete my task?
Yes, I did what you asked. The dwarfs are destroyed, and here is your device.
Brother... do you have it?
What is it?
You know what. Do you have anything to drink?
Brother, are you crazy? Someone might hear us.

I really need it, I haven't had a drop in three months, and here... It's somehow... anyway, I can't... Bring me and my buddy five bottles, and for that, I'll give you my brand new pistol - a Glock. Took it from one "infidel".
Sorry brother, but I don't have any vodka.
Here, take it. Just keep it quiet so Solomon doesn't see.
Brother, do you have any extra food?
What do you want?
I could use some canned food, about five cans. I'm hungry, and Makhon won't give credit.
Alright, if I get some, I'll bring it.
Hello!
Hello to you too. Here, take this, found exactly five cans.
Brother, thank you, and I have nothing to thank you with... Although, listen, I have a transmutation recipe here, record it to your PDA. It will come in handy.
Thanks for the recipe. Good luck, brother. Glory to the Monolith!
Brother, any batteries for the PDA?
No, where from?
Well, there isn't a shop nearby, of course, but there is a way. Bring me five of any PDAs, and I'll dig the batteries out of them somehow.
Alright brother. If I collect five PDAs, I'll bring them.
Hello brother, did you collect them?
Yes, here, take them!
Thank you! Wait, let me thank you. I have a "Vog" grenade launcher here, brand new, and some ammo for the Kalash. Here, take it.
Did you call, Charon?
Yes, brother. I have business for you.
I am listening to you, Leader.

Solomon's group spotted several stalkers at CNPP-2. It turns out that an enemy is roaming in our rear. These infidels not only refuse to step on the true path, but also defile the "Holy Places" with their presence.
Give me permission, I will grind them into dust. These infidels will get what they deserve!

Do not rush. You will not go alone. Solomon's group awaits you. Find them. Note, I need Solomon alive. You answer for him with your head! Here is a little ammo and a couple of medkits for you. You will find the transition to CNPP-2 in the room with the Monolith, to the left of it.
Thank you, Leader, for the trust. I will not let you down. Glory to the Monolith!
Greetings to you, brother!
You are on time, brother, everything is ready, we are waiting only for you.
What are the plans?
We move out slowly, we go as a group, you are slightly ahead... That's it, let's move out!
Glory to the Monolith! May his strength and power be with us!
Leader, you are teaching me the same thing again... But alright... I listen and obey... Leader, I brought joyful news.
It is good that you are patient and obedient. I have already been reported about your exploits. Well done! Glory to the Monolith! He does not abandon his children and helps them in difficult times.
Well, infidel, shall I shoot you like a dog?
Don't, I beg you, don't! Don't kill me!
You and your people defiled the Holy Places, there is no mercy for you.
Brother.... Brother, don't kill me... I... I sincerely want to believe. I am ready to reunite with You. But now, I beg you, give, give me a medkit.
Fine, here is a medkit.
I don't have a medkit. Die, infidel!
Thank you, brother! Listen, I have a transmutation recipe. Record it in your PDA, it will come in handy.
I am listening to you, brother.
Brother, you showed your good side, I see - you are a smart guy. There is a special task for you.
Speak Solomon. I am glad to be trusted, especially by such a master as you.

So, brother. When we first arrived here, it wasn't so deserted. Here and there one could meet squads of military stalkers. Somehow we managed to escort them out of here. Oh, we lost many brothers back then! But, Glory to the Monolith, we survived and the enemies are defeated. From one of our brothers, by the way, a former special forces soldier who participated in the special operation, we learned that they were looking for documentation that one scientist, who worked before the Big Blow (Dorodin seems to be his surname), carefully collected and put into 3 fireproof cases. They never managed to find the documents... We managed to track the location of 2 cases. I sent the coordinates to your PDA, but the third one vanished into thin air. Well, soldier, listen to the order: dig through the entire western part of CNPP-2, but find the 3 cases. The only thing else I can say is that a weak signal, possibly from the third case, is coming from somewhere on the outer upper levels of the Sarcophagus. I will mark the approximate place on your PDA. But, the thing is, you can only get to the upper levels through a teleport anomaly, and my fighters are afraid to climb into it.
Solomon. I will do everything I can, and even more. May the strength and mind of the Monolith be with me. May my faith help me! I am ready!
Glory to the Monolith, I did not let you down, Solomon.
Did you find them?
Yes Solomon, here they are - all three.

Your merits before the flock are great! You are an example of a good brother. Your humility and diligence will not go unnoticed, brother. The Monolith sees and hears everything. A great honor is prepared for you. But for now, allow me to reward you. Here, take five F-1 grenades. Let the enemies fear you even more!
Brother, I have business.
What do you want?

Brother, help me out. Solomon gave me and my partner a task to clear the CNPP-2 territory of monsters. But disaster struck. Snorks dragged my partner away and... devoured him. I told him not to drink, there is only sin in it... So the Monolith got angry. Anyway, I have two days left, and I'm afraid to go alone... But what will I tell Solomon then? I need to present him with proof. And where will I get it if I didn't go anywhere. Please, get 8 snork feet. Help me out, huh? And in return, I'll give you six packs of buckshot. But be careful. Snorks jump on roofs like mad horses! They live not far from here, slightly west of our camp. But, I repeat, be careful! Watch the roofs, lure them out from there...
I will try to get the snork feet for you. Just don't drink anymore, brother. For us, who have stepped on the path of "Truth", drinking is a sin.
Well, how is it there, brother?
I got the snork feet for you.
Eight pieces? Oh, thank you brother, you really helped me out! Here, take the buckshot, as I promised.
Greetings, Charon! Glory to the Monolith!
Soldier, one floor above us is the Monolith Control Bunker. We want to create a control and coordination center in this place over time. But right now it's... gloom. Basically, just monsters...
Leader, what must I do?

The task on one hand is simple - clear the bunker of filth. But on the other hand... who knows how many of them are there. The passage through the Sarcophagus is blocked, so for now the only way there is through CNPP-2. Look, I sent a marker to your PDA. The entrance to the control bunker is in this place. Look at the map in your PDA. Yes, and here are a couple of medkits and some ammo for the Kalash, just in case. And I'll also give you a shotgun, an MP-133, which helped me out more than once in difficult times. Take care of it, it will be handier to complete the task with it. Let this be a reward from me for your agility and loyalty.
I was in the Bunker.
And what is there?
Just zombies and burers. But, strictly speaking, there were also several bloodsuckers, I had to tinker with them.
Well done. As always, I was not mistaken when I chose you specifically for this task.
Master, is there serious work?
Are you really ready for serious work?
I think so. I want to earn your trust even more.
You are a young fighter showing great promise, therefore, you now need to undergo additional training. Go to your savior - to Mervin, he will conduct several lessons with you.
Where should I look for him?
Mervin is a keeper of the Monolith. You will find him here, in the Sarcophagus, next to our "Treasure".
Alright, I will go find Mervin.
Greetings, Mervin. Charon sent me to you.

Yes, Charon already warned me. He says he is generally pleased with you, sees great prospects in you. But you have a lot of audacity and freethinking. In connection with all this, it is required to teach you strength of spirit, courage, as well as humility and tolerance. Just don't take this as punishment. This is special training that every new fighter who has earned the Leader's trust undergoes.
Understood.
Greetings, Charon. Mervin told me that you have some urgent business for me.

Yes, soldier. An urgent matter has appeared: there is a healer, called the Swamp Doctor. He lives in the Swamps, not far from Pripyat. Well, it doesn't matter. He makes medicines for us, and we don't touch him for that. In addition, we supply him with artifacts, valuable and rare ones, which can only be found here, on the CNPP territory. Right now we have many sick, especially at CNPP-2. So: you need to go to Pripyat urgently, meet with the Doctor or his courier and pick up some medicines. The Doctor rarely comes himself, usually sends his student. Called Feldsher. A persistent fellow... But anyway, closer to the point: I have no one else to send right now but you, so get ready for the road.
Clear. Where do I look for the meeting place in Pripyat?

Look at the stadium. The Doctor or his student usually hang out there when they come to Pripyat. I will place a marker on this spot in your PDA. You will go to Pripyat through the CNPP. Here, look, I will send you the coordinates of the transition from the Sarcophagus to the CNPP. And there, I hope, you will find how to get to Pripyat.
Master, here are the medicines.
Let me take a look, so... so, seems like everything is here. How did you find the Doctor?

The Doctor wasn't there, his student was - Feldsher. A normal guy, pity he's not one of us. True, he said that we owed him and demanded payment: either artifacts or mutant parts. Had to run around a bit.

I see. And regarding these healers: I don't like them, oh, I don't like them. We would have shot them long ago, but the Swamp Doctor... In short, he is the only doctor in the area, so we have to tolerate it. Last time, when the Doctor himself brought medicines, he shot my courier, said that he treated him rudely. And I do not forgive anyone for such things... Everything has its time.
Alright, Charon, I understood everything.
Greetings, are you Dyak?
Yes, that's me. Brother. You can't pass further alone. We noticed a squad of military, clearly not conscripts. They laid down two of my scouts, they didn't even have time to make a sound.
Brother, I am in a hurry. I have an urgent errand from Charon. By the way, why do you have such a bandit-like mug? Are you from the former ones?

The mug is normal, you don't choose it! Yes, I was a bandit. In one skirmish in Pripyat with a Monolith squad I was wounded. Solomon found me, but didn't finish me off, instead he healed me, then enlightened me and directed me to the true path. So I am in his debt. Now I serve the Monolith faithfully and truly! That's it, enough philosophy, it is restless here... Help me out, brother! I am personally responsible to Charon for this sector. He will tear my head off for the fact that soldiers are on my territory. I have a gun here - PP-19 "Bizon". If you help, it's yours.
Alright, brother, you speak sense, I will help. Later I have another question for you... But first let's get the job done. Moving out.
Well, how are you, Dyak?
Those bitches! They laid down many of our brothers. But I am intact, Glory to the Monolith. Although it seems I got grazed a little.
Well, okay brother, I am in a hurry.
Wait. Here, as promised. Take the gun, a little ammo for it, and a scope. May the strength and spirit of the Monolith be with you!
Dyak, I am performing a task for Solomon here, and only you can help.
Speak, what is the essence of the question. I will help however I can. You really helped me out, and I am in debt to Solomon.

Solomon asked me to bring him something, specifically: a crate of canned food from Pripyat and also a container with medicines, which, he says, Makhon hid somewhere on the CNPP territory. And apparently, you know where exactly, and can give a hint. Solomon trusts you.
So that's it... Well, I won't tell you the exact place, because I don't know it myself. Makhon hid that container alone in secret. But I saw out of the corner of my eye which way he went then.
Alright, searching for who knows what and who knows where is nothing new to me, speak the approximate landmarks.

He, meaning Makhon, when he came here to the CNPP two months ago, was very secretive and taciturn. He only asked me to send a patrol to the eastern part of the CNPP to clear the area of mutants if discovered. My guys did everything, returned and reported. And then he went alone, asked not to be accompanied. He had a metal container with medicines with him, I definitely spied that. He returned later without it. I saw that he went out through the eastern gates, well these ones, behind you, not far from where we are now, and then walked around the locomotive and went towards the old freight train. That's where you should search. Maybe you'll find his stash.
Understood everything. I'll try to find the container in the eastern part of the CNPP.
Greetings to you, Charon sent me.
What does he want?
Medicines, as always.
So tell him that he will receive nothing. We gave on credit several times, but this time patience has run out. Let him pay up first.
M-m-m... Feldsher, I cannot return without medicines, we have many sick people.
Want to get medicines? Well then you pay! Why can't he understand that I need artifacts and monster parts so that I can produce medicines. No artifacts - no medicines.
Feldsher, what is needed? I will try to get it.
Two "Night Star" artifacts.
Here, Feldsher, I have exactly two, found them on the way here.
I don't have a "Night Star". Maybe bring something else?
Then bring ten dog tails.
I have tails. Here, take them.
I don't have that many tails either, I'll go look.
Well done! I look at you and don't understand, what have you forgotten among fanatics?
Well done, how quick! I look at you and don't understand, what have you forgotten among fanatics?
We are not fanatics, we believe in the truth, in... Although honestly speaking, I've confused myself...

That's empty talk, guy. You don't believe what you are saying yourself... I've heard similar words from your predecessors more than once. I am used to looking people in the eye. So, everyone who was before you had empty eyes, but yours... Yours are burning! Not my business, of course, but think, why and for what do you believe in this... stone. Yes, the stone is not simple, there is a lot of mysterious and incomprehensible in it, but whatever you say, it is just a stone.
Respectable one, I do not advise you to utter such words in my presence.
Alright, guy, I won't detain you anymore. Just listen to your heart more often, trust it, and it will give you the right advice - so the Doctor taught.
Respectable one, do you happen to do repairs? %c[orange][Repair]
A little bit.
Repair the first weapon.
Repair the second weapon.
Repair the armor.
Yeah, at such prices I am not ready to repair yet.
Well, look, good as new.
Yeah, who do you have to be to bring a suit to such a state... Alright, have to change all the plates.
Hey, not bad, thank you.
Listen, I think it's even better now than when it was new.
There is something else here, won't you take a look?
Yes, please, what do we have:
Greetings, Mentor. %c[orange][Barter]
Come closer, my brother, I am listening to you.
Mentor, I brought something - take a look.
Artifacts?
I have a "Stone Flower".
I have a "Stone Blood".
I have a "Night Star".
I have a "Soul".
I have a "Spring".
I have a "Crystal".
I have a "Goldfish".
I have a "Meat Chunk".
I have a "Gravi".
Oh, forgive me Mentor, I was mistaken.
Not much, well then, here are three packs of ammo for the Kalash, standard, one medkit and one antirad.
You work poorly, but okay - take two standard medkits.
O-o-oh, "Night Star"! Let me look at it... Not a frequent guest with us, well done, here is ammo for you, five packs for the Groza, armor-piercing, two scientific medkits and two antirads.
A rare artifact! You earned a reward. Here, NATO ammo, five packs, improved, plus three scientific medkits.
No one has brought a "Spring" for a long time. Here, five packs of armor-piercing for the SVU, plus two antirads.
You brought a "Crystal"? You pleased me, take five packs of ammo for the Vintorez, no, not armor-piercing, standard, but instead, here are two more army medkits.
For the "Goldfish" you are entitled to this: ammo for the Kalash, armor-piercing, five packs, plus two army medkits, yes, and here take four cans of stew.
For "Meat Chunk" I will give you ammo for the Kalash, three packs, standard, plus two simple medkits and four sticks of sausage.
For "Gravi" - here is NATO ammo, three packs, standard, plus two simple medkits and four sticks of sausage.
Mentor, I need to repair something. %c[orange][Repair]
Indeed, our enemies do not sleep, let me see.
Repair the first weapon.
Repair the second weapon.
Repair the armor.
Leader, I don't have enough money.
Here is your weapon, brother, let our enemies tremble.
Armor patched up. Glory to the Monolith! To spite our enemies, another brother is ready to defend our truth.
Thank you, Mentor.
I am ready to carry the truth to those deaf and blind ones again. Glory to the Monolith!
Mentor, there is something else.
Oh, you took quite a beating, let me have a look:
Master, I heard that mercenaries captured our base in Pripyat?
There is such a matter. We chase them out of Pripyat, and they keep coming and coming.
Well, maybe it's time for us to show who is the master of Pripyat?

I think so too. Listen, soldier, Makhon is already there with his guys. You get ready too. Talk to him, he will explain everything to you. But note: Makhon is my right hand. I will hold you personally responsible if he dies during the assault. And then, when you return, you will continue your special training with Mervin.
Greetings, Master. Victory! Makhon is alive and well.

Makhon already reported. You did well! Glory to the Monolith! He does not abandon us in difficult times. Now I think they won't meddle with us for a long time. Although we shouldn't relax either. We have many enemies, many...
I serve the Monolith!
Mentor, are you already in position?

For a long time already. See the guys with me... These are the best of the best! Maybe you will become one of them someday too. Heard about the "Inner Circle"? In short, it is our guard. No fear, no mercy, no pain and no compassion.
I hope I will become one of them someday. Well, Makhon, shall we move out slowly?
Let's go brother, indeed, we've been sitting too long.
Mentor, did you call?
Wait... let me catch my breath.
Makhon, I'm not rushing, everyone had a hard time.
That's not all. We still need to clear the central square, take the guys and go towards the Lenin monument.
Executing already.
Whew... I'm tired somehow. What a day.
Yes, we had to work. But the result is positive. We liberated our base and the city center. Now mercenaries hold only the outskirts. But it's nothing, we'll get to them too.
Alright, Makhon, I'm off. Need to report to Charon.
Brother. Here, take this anomaly detector. Well, of course, not the best one, but it will save your life a couple of times, that's for sure.
Respectable one, do you have anything for sale?
I have something for sale, besides trading I can offer an exchange: you give me monster parts, just note: I take parts in bulk, ten pieces each, and I will give you medkits and ammo for them.
Alright, when I find them - I'll bring them.
Here, I have something here. %c[orange][Barter]
What do you have there?
I have ten flesh eyes.
I have ten boar hooves.
I have ten blind dog tails.
I have ten pseudodog tails.
I have ten bloodsucker tentacles.
I have ten burer hands.
I have ten zombie hands.
I have ten snork feet.
I have ten tushkano heads.
I have ten controller hands.
I have ten pseudogiant paws.
I have ten chimera claws.
Unfortunately, I am empty today.
Give them here, they make decent medicines! Here, I give you four scientific medkits for them.
For ten hooves I will give you four army medkits.
How did you get them? Well done! Here are four packs of buckshot.
Pseudodogs are very dangerous. Didn't think you were capable of such a thing. Here are F1 grenades, four pieces.
10 bloodsucker tentacles? You are a dangerous man! Here are four packs of ammo for the Val and Vintorez, armor-piercing.
10 burer hands? Where did you find them? Well okay, here are four packs of NATO ammo, armor-piercing.
For civilian zombie hands I will give you... I'll give you five packs of buckshot.
Snorks, br-r-r... I don't like them. I had an unpleasant story with them once... Here are four standard medkits.
Tushkanos. And how did you catch them? They are so nimble. Here are five packs of 9x18 ammo, armor-piercing.
Controllers. Wow, damn it! You are... alright, here are five antirads for that.
Pseudogiants? Pseudogiants - yes, huge beasts... Here are seven packs of NATO ammo, standard.
A Chimera is a dangerous monster, here are five packs of ammo for the Kalash, armor-piercing.
If you find anything, come back.
What do you want, brother?

Brother, I have business for you. We are here, consider it the edge of the earth, there are no shops, you understand yourself, but we are still people, and we need to eat and need medicines. Charon is resolving this issue, but until everything settles down, we will swell from hunger here or kick the bucket from some cholera.
How can I help you?

Charon will sooner or later send you to Pripyat... So, there is a store there. It is of course not working, some former grocery store, but I am practically 100% sure there must be products there. I don't know, canned food... maybe something else. Brother, help out, if you find something, bring it. But that is not all yet... One Doctor prepares and supplies medicines for our brotherhood, but Makhon is holding them back for my guys, with whom we guard the inner territory of the CNPP here. This is all because we once argued with him on the topic of our faith, so he is taking revenge slowly. But I know that Makhon has a stash with medicines on the CNPP territory. One of our brothers told me about this. He is called Dyak. You can get to Pripyat from the Sarcophagus only through the outer territory of the CNPP, and Dyak is currently in charge there. You must talk to him. Say that at my request you are looking for what I am asking you to bring. He will help, he is in some debt to me.

Alright, brother, I will help. When I am in Pripyat, I will look for something for you. I will look into the grocery store and on the CNPP territory I will try to find the container with medicines. I hope Dyak helps.
Well, brother, I brought joyful news.
What is the news?

I was in Pripyat, I found this grocery store - it's empty there. Apparently, someone had already been there before me, and probably more than once. But still, after searching, I found one crate with canned food. And at the CNPP I finally found the place where the container with medicines was hidden. It wasn't simple, I want to tell you, it was very not simple.
Canned food - that is good, there is less radiation in it. Well, give it here, what you brought. I want to thank you. Here, choose:
Eotech sight.
PSO sight.
SMG MP5A3.
Take the sight.
Take the sight.
Take the SMG.
My training is finished, Master. How else can I be useful?

Soldier, there is a task for you. Dyak's people caught a stalker. He is currently on the CNPP territory. Your task is to interrogate him, find out everything and... eliminate him. We don't need spies. But don't get your hands dirty yourself - Dyak will do everything independently - he knows how to solve such issues without unnecessary pathos. Your task is to interrogate the spy, find out everything and report to me.
Obey, executing already.
Well, speak, who are you?
Friend, don't kill me, I'll say everything!
Stop whining, you knew what you were getting into. Now, perhaps, only a frank confession will save you.
Brother, brother, I'll say everything, please, don't kill me!
That's it, you've driven me to the edge, for the last time... Who are you and what were you looking for here?

Serga... My name is Serga. Ghost sent me... Or rather, there were three of us, but these guys... laid down two of us. Ghost... it's all him! He sent us here, we were looking for how to sneak into the control bunker.
Why did you need the bunker? And who is Ghost?

Docu... documents, brother, have mercy... that's... that's it, I'm silent. I don't know exactly, some important documents. Seems to be a map of the underground communications of Pripyat and the Sarcophagus.
Who is Ghost?

He seems to be former military, maybe KGB. He... He... I... We worked together lately. He was looking for a way to sneak into the Sarcophagus, bypassing the posts. Why? I don't know myself, Ghost never spoke about it.
Where can he be found?
I don't know exactly, lately we were either in Pripyat or on the Radar, but where his base is - I don't know.
Interrogation finished.
No, brother! Brother, don't kill me. Don't... I beg you, tell this Dyak to let me go, I told you everything I knew.
I said - interrogation finished.
Greetings, Master. May the power of the Monolith be with us!
What news did you bring, soldier?

I interrogated the spy. His name was Serga. He and two other stalkers were looking for some documents, a map of the Pripyat undergrounds. Maybe he's lying, although unlikely. And Dyak is truly a "beast"... Yes, the spy also mentioned a stalker by the nickname Ghost.
Ghost... Something familiar. I'm sure it's somehow connected to this Swamp Doctor and his Feldsher. But anyway. Soldier, rest for now. If needed - I will call.
Master, are there tasks? I've been sitting too long. Starting to get nervous...
Well done, soldier! Soon I will recommend you for a serious reward and promotion. But for now, there is no work. If needed - I will call. That is All. Rest, pray and strengthen your faith!
Feldsher, you asked me to come by.
Yes, yes, I need you very - very much.
What happened?
I don't know if you've heard of a man named Ghost or not, and if you have, probably bad things. But I need your help.
Of course, I heard about him, quite recently. I would talk to this Ghost with pleasure.
Well, so you will talk. But there is just a small hitch.
Getting interesting.
In order to talk to him, he must first be freed. Mercenaries captured him, they are holding him in Pripyat. I will send you the coordinates.
Strange that they didn't shoot him.

Nothing strange. There is nothing to take from your brother. You are fanatics. It is easier to kill you than try to squeeze something out of you. But from him, one can. Especially since I suspect the real reason is me and the Doctor.
Why did you decide that?
Because the Swamp Doctor is the only doctor in the district, and I am his faithful student. They came several times already, but both the Doctor and I refused them, so they hold a grudge.
Strange scruples... As I understand, you and the Doctor are not thrilled with us either. But you supply us with medicines. Are we better than them by your standards?

You are fanatics. At least half of you, and I think even more, do not control yourselves. I don't know what controls you and how, but I hope to find out. Even you... yes, yes... even you yourself do not notice that you have not been your own master for a long time. So I feel sorry for you.

Interesting theory. Worst of all is that I, unfortunately, do not remember who I was before, before I got here. I don't remember what my name was before, how I got into the Zone. I don't remember why I ended up in Pripyat. I remember nothing. Memories start only from the moment Mervin saved me. Pulled me out of an anomaly... Alright, send Ghost's coordinates. I'll go do what I do best - kill!
Give me your PDA... So, here, marked the place. If everything goes well, drop by on the way back. I have something for you.
Are you Ghost?
A minute ago I was, but now I don't even know... First time I see a Monolithian helping me. Usually, one can expect nothing but a bullet from you.
Jokes later, Feldsher sent me. That's it, moving out. Follow me.
Attaboy Feldsher, I underestimated him! Thought he only blindly carried out the Doctor's errands.
Let's go, I said.
Well, you are free.
Freedom is a conditional concept. You freed me from the mercenaries so that I became dependent on you.
How I am sick of you smart alecks. Feldsher, now you... His theory about some device or whatever, that controls us. Let's talk about what is certain. What documents are you looking for?

What are you talking about? A-a-ah... understood. Did they get caught after all? Yes, but there were no other people at hand, and the documents were needed. Rather, I understood that this trio wouldn't find the documents. All that was required of them was to conduct, so to speak, reconnaissance at the CNPP and check how many of your brothers are there and where.
And what kind of documents?

Documents... You don't believe that there is some device that controls you, do you? But I and the Doctor believe. That is exactly what we are looking for. And it is located somewhere in the Sarcophagus. But where exactly is unknown to me.
What is happening to me... Just half a day ago I wanted to shoot you, and now... now I don't even know. But note, if you get caught again, I won't have pity.
Feldsher, here I am. Ghost is free.

Thank you. Still, I understand more and more that I was not mistaken in you. You definitely need to meet with the Doctor and talk to him. He will explain everything to you better than I can. He can surely help you.
You are at it again. I don't need any help. Stop it. This is my conscious path. Yes, and warn your Ghost that if he pokes his nose into our place again, I won't let him leave alive.
You are stubborn, but okay. Here, I have a transmutation recipe. Write it down, might be needed.
Leader, did you call me?
Yes, I called. We calculated Ghost, he is in Pripyat.
What now?

I learned something about him. He must be eliminated urgently, before he causes trouble here. Yes, I thought that no one would cope better than you. So the honor of killing the little reptile fell to you. I believe that you will succeed. You haven't let me down once yet.
I won't let you down now either, Charon!
Feldsher, what happened?
You seem to have received a task to kill Ghost?
Once again I am amazed by your awareness. In my opinion, you know more about me than I do myself.
I am the assistant and associate of the Doctor, don't forget that. And some patients, let's say, out of gratitude... Well, further, I hope, is clear to you.
Alright, Feldsher, let's get closer to the point.
You must not kill Ghost.
I have an order! I must, and Ghost himself I don't like. He is shady somehow.
M-m-m-m... I didn't want to, but... Apparently I have to.
Didn't want what?
Oh... what's wrong with me? I feel sick, I feel so crappy.
It's okay, it will pass. Endure a little. I injected you with a potent sedative. This is, so to say, the aftereffect of it.
There is something wrong with my head, I can't remember anything...

Don't worry, your memory will return, but gradually. I hope this will help you remember who you really are and how you ended up in Pripyat. I don't even know what to call you. You there in your "Brotherhood" are almost all nameless. Brothers, in a word. Yes, I put a helmet there for you. Under no circumstances throw it away. It will be able to protect you from psi-radiation. If you take it off, the Monolith will start controlling you again.

Guy, give me time to come to my senses... Me... My name is Strelok. I remembered! I remembered why I came to Pripyat! I am looking for my brother! Do you... Do you happen to know anything about a stalker nicknamed "Captain" and about a raid of stalkers to the Sarcophagus two years and a bit ago?

Well, hello, Strelok! I congratulate you on "returning" to yourself. I don't know a stalker nicknamed Captain. And I haven't heard about a raid to the Sarcophagus two years ago either. I'm new to the Zone... And just in case, I'll tell you: don't forget, your former friends are no longer your friends. So I don't advise you to go back. At the CNPP, they are unlikely to be happy about your arrival. I would advise you to get away from Pripyat altogether. You definitely need to get to the Swamp Doctor. With him, you can find answers to many of your questions. Perhaps he knows something about your brother. Ghost can help you get to the "Swamps". Speaking of Ghost. He is in danger, I'm sure. This Charon always insures himself. Probably, besides you, he sent someone else in case you fail. You need Ghost. Don't let him die.
Feldsher, or whatever your name is, I don't remember who Ghost, Charon and others are. Why can't you take me to the Doctor yourself?

See, your memory is returning gradually. We are stuck here a bit in Pripyat... The old path to the Swamps through the Radar is currently inaccessible, and there is no other one yet... But, as I said, Ghost can help find a path to the "Swamps", and I still have some business in Pripyat. Okay, to start with, I will drop a marker on Ghost's location. You need to find him urgently. Perhaps Charon's people are already there. I hope you haven't forgotten how to hold a weapon?
I think it's innate... Alright, I'll go find Ghost.
Are you Ghost? I feel like I've seen you before.
That happened.
No... no, I don't recall.

Recently... Alright, you don't remember anything anyway. Listen to me. Feldsher said to lead you out of Pripyat to the Swamps to the Doctor. But there is a problem. The passage to the Radar is controlled by mercenaries. And even if you pass, further on, a rather strong psi-radiation has formed recently. No protection will help you against it, you will die quickly and painfully. When it will change location is unknown, and there is no time to wait. There is another secret path to the Swamps from Pripyat. But where is it? There is information that somewhere in the Sarcophagus, in the control bunker, there are secret documents. If you find them, the transition should be displayed on them. Bring the documents to me, I will try to decipher them. Can you find the way to the Control Bunker?
I will try.
Ghost, here are the documents.

Found them? Well done! Let me have a look. Aha... so... That's it, figured it out. Alright, now go to Fang, he will escort you to the place. I will send him the coordinates of the transition, and he will show you the path on the spot, it's not far, but safer together.
Understood, coming already. Yes, by the way, I remembered practically everything! I remembered, for example, that I saved you recently from mercenary captivity.
Your memory is recovering quickly. Alright, go. There is no time, good luck and thank you!
You take care too, Ghost, hope to see you again.
Are you Fang?
The very same, Ghost informed me. Ready to go?
Yes, ready! I have nothing else to do here.
We walk carefully, no rushing, the main thing is not to run into a Monolith patrol. That's it, let's go.
Are we there?
Yes, look here: the transition to the Swamps is just behind me, I sent a marker to your PDA. Well that's it, brother, farewell. Good luck to you, see you again. Give my regards to the Doctor!
All the best to you too, see you.
Wait-wait... Ghost wants something from us here. Aha, here... sent a message. In short, he asks to return to him.
Damn it! I already had one foot, so to speak, stepping from Pripyat to the "Swamps", and now returning again...
Don't worry, it's quick, Ghost writes that he forgot to personally hand you something very important from the Doctor.
Ah, well then alright, let's return to Ghost.
Hello again. What do you have for me?

My memory is useless, I completely forgot, Feldsher passed something here for you as a gift: three army medkits and his MP5, it saved his life more than once, he says you need it more. Here, take it and, as they say, break a leg, brother.
Same to you. Big thanks to Feldsher from me. You know, it's a little scary... what awaits me there?

Don't chicken out! You are a sensible guy, everything will be fine! If anything, you know where to find us. And now go, the Doctor is waiting for you. Yes, and here is my advice: don't think about touching the Doctor's "patients" - he won't like it, understood?
Understood, okay. That's it, I'm going to the Swamps to the Doctor, we'll surely see each other again somehow.
Who are you?
Don't recognize me, scum?
You won't believe it - I really don't recognize you. Feldsher in Pripyat cleared my brains thoroughly.
You know Feldsher?
Do I know Feldsher? He cleared my whole head. I am clean as a baby. Consider it a second life.
Feldsher is the assistant of the Swamp Doctor, but neither he nor the Doctor told me anything about you... Hmmm.
Believe me, I'm not lying, haven't learned how yet. I just haven't met the Swamp Doctor yet, but I've heard a lot about him, including from Feldsher.
Listen, what's your name?
My name is Strelok! You took all my weapons, equipment, loot and money! Give it all back to me!

Don't yell like that. I didn't take your things or your money. I don't do such things. I found you here already lying unconscious, as they say, in just your underwear. Apparently, those who robbed you decided that you had already kicked the bucket, otherwise they wouldn't have left you alive. So, consider yourself lucky.
If not you, then who knocked me out and robbed me?

That is unknown to me. I can only assume it was one of your "old friends" from the Sarcophagus. And now listen here, Strelok. You don't move right now, and I slowly... very slowly hand you a gun and ammo. Got it?
Although I am a "baby", I am quick-witted.
Listen, why did you help me?

It's all the Doctor. Say thank you to him if you see him. He and Feldsher once saved me. I now consider myself indebted to them for life, especially to the Doctor. And they cleared my brains, just like yours.
Why didn't you leave here?

Where to? And why? I was in good standing with Charon, he sent me to command at CNPP-2. I am practically my own master here. Well, sometimes I have to do dirty work. And besides, you don't know how many enemies I have on the other side. I wouldn't last a day there. And I am old already...
Listen, I am planning to bolt to the other side. Maybe you have a request?
M-m-m... Yes, perhaps there is one. I need to send a parcel there, to the big world. My daughter is there, true, she is grown up already. I haven't seen her for about ten years.
Unlikely to succeed.

There is one person at the Cordon, a trader. They call him Barman. He will help. Back when I was a loner, I was always amazed at the deals he pulled off. Yes, and to interest you, I will give you a transmutation recipe. How to make the "Hide" modification from the "Film" artifact, if you help.
No need, I'll take it anyway.

It's necessary, brother, necessary. Times are like that. So. As soon as you agree, don't come to me. Let the Barman write me a note. Perhaps he even remembers me. And I will then send the recipe to your PDA.
Barman, I have business with you, all the way from the CNPP.
What business?
Need to send a parcel there, to the "Big World".

D-damn... Are you crazy?! You form the CNPP are all like that. You come, rest a week or two at the Cordon, drink umpteen liters of vodka. Spouting such utter nonsense. Or maybe you want a woman? There you go! Don't bother me.
Barman, my dear friend! I want a woman, and vodka, but most of all, for you to send the parcel. What do you want in return?
Do you think it's that simple? Over there (points head towards the checkpoint) people also want to eat and drink.
Alright, Barman, don't stall. How much?
Two "Crystal" artifacts, got it?
Here, take them.
I don't have them.
Then two "Film" artifacts.
I have these, take them.
I don't have those either.
Then come when you have them.
Give me the "Crystals". And don't worry, the channel is reliable, everything will be tip-top.
Give me the "Films". And don't worry, the channel is reliable, everything will be tip-top.
Barman, hello! How about the parcel?
Brought them?
Yes, here, I have exactly two "Crystal" artifacts with me.
Yes, here, I have exactly two "Film" artifacts with me.
No, I just dropped by. Alright, I'll go look.
Give me the "Crystals". And don't worry, the channel is reliable, everything will be tip-top.
Give me the "Films". And don't worry, the channel is reliable, everything will be tip-top.
Have anything for sale? %c[orange][Barter]
I can offer buckshot, standard medkits or simple ammo for the Kalash.
Need buckshot.
Need medkits.
Need ammo for the Kalash.

I exchange five packs of buckshot for:
 - 8 blind dog tails,
 - 6 boar hooves,
 - 6 chimera claws,
 - 2 "Twist" artifacts.
Zahar, I have tails.
Zahar, I have hooves.
Zahar, I have claws.
Zahar, I have "Twists".
I am empty today.

I exchange three medkits for:
 - 8 pseudodog tails,
 - 1 "Slug" artifact,
 - 1 "Stone Flower" artifact,
 - 1 "Gravi" artifact.
Zahar, I have pseudodog tails.
Zahar, I have a "Slug" artifact.
Zahar, I have a "Stone Flower" artifact.
Zahar, I have a "Gravi" artifact.

I exchange five packs of simple ammo for the Kalash for:
 - 6 bloodsucker tentacles,
 - 1 "Meat Chunk" artifact,
 - 2 "Slime" artifacts,
 - 2 "Jellyfish" artifacts.
Zahar, I have tentacles.
Zahar, I have a "Meat Chunk" artifact.
Zahar, I have 2 "Slime" artifacts.
Zahar, I have 2 "Jellyfish" artifacts.
Completely forgot... Seems I have something for you.
What?
A message from your friend... From Zahar. Do you know him?
Zahar? Haven't heard about him for a long time. Thought he was long dead. Where did you meet him? How is he, my old friend, doing?
Zahar is fine. He has been wandering through forests and fields with "Hunters" for a long time. Here, he asked to pass you a personal letter. Says he wants to make peace.
That old fart! I never held a grudge against him. I think he didn't either. We argued out of stupidity back then. Well okay, what's past is past... You brought me good news, guy.
Here, take the letter.
Hello guys, who are you?
We are Freedomers, and who are you yourself?
They call me Strelok.
Strelok, desire to earn some money? You help us at the same time, we won't remain in debt.
What is the job?
There is a military base behind the hills. Their commander is Belchuk, a rare bastard. Caught three of ours yesterday and immediately put them against the wall. That scumbag! Wait, I'll get to him.
I see. What next?

We need this base desperately. Until we kick the soldiers out of there, the passage to the center of the Zone is closed for stalkers. So we are looking for free stalkers who are not afraid and will go with us. As you can see, there aren't many of us. So an extra gun wouldn't hurt. Will you come with us? Don't worry, I'll pay well. Brother, think for yourself, the Zone is our home, yours and mine. And it's not for soldiers to tell us where and why to go. We risk every day here without them. Every other day we lose a friend. And this Belchuk implies total lawlessness. Seized power and wastes our brothers. Whoever gets caught - is shot on the spot.
Okay-okay brother, you persuaded me, so, when are we moving out?
Right now.
Well then, let's go.
Well, Lukash, the base is ours! Belchuk is dead.
Yes, half the job is done.
What do you mean half? You seemed to say that we needed to capture the base and that's it - job done.
We still need to kick the soldiers out from the Barrier, and only then that's it. The path to the center is relatively free.
Why didn't you say so immediately?
Come on, we are doing a necessary deed. As soon as we capture the Barrier, I'll pay, don't worry. Come on, brother, hurry, before the soldiers realize.
Am I going alone?
No, of course not. Look, Cap and the guys will go too. Protect Cap, he must remain alive.
Alright, convinced.
Well, Lukash, the Barrier is ours!
Glory to the heroes! You did a great job. Here, hold this, earned by blood and sweat.
Lukash, listen, I need to get to the Bar.
To the Bar? Why do you need to go there?
I have business there.

Well, business is business. But I don't know the way to the Bar. We don't go there. We have a war with Duty, you know. But there is one guy at the farm, the Informer. Maybe he knows, he roams everywhere. Ask him.
Thanks for the tip.
Greetings. Are you the Informer?
Well, suppose it's me. What do you want?
I need to find a way to the Bar.
To the Bar? Heh... It costs money.
How much?
I'm not interested in money. Bring me a "Mama's Beads" artifact, then we'll talk.
Agreed.
Informer, here is the artifact.
Excellent! So, listen. Go straight along the road, past the Barrier, there will be a turn to the right. That's the road to the Bar. But be careful, there are plenty of dogs there.
Thanks.
Stand back! Access to the base is closed for outsiders!
I need to see General Voronin. I have important information.
What information can a stalker have? Get out of here while you're still intact.
Tell the General that I helped capture the Freedom base. I think he will be interested.
You? Helped Freedom? Hah! And you came here to brag about it? Guys, fire!
Wait! You misunderstood. I helped DEAL with the Freedom base. I can help you too.
Is that so? Hmm... Alright. But if you're lying, we'll hang you on the nearest tree. Go, the General is in the bunker.
Greetings, General.
Who are you and how did you get in here?
My name is Strelok. Your man Plichko let me through.
Strelok? Haven't heard of you. What do you need?
I'm looking for work. And information.

Work... There is always work for brave people. But trust must be earned. I have a task. Our scouts reported that bandits in the Dark Valley have some documents. They concern our safety. You need to get them.
Where exactly in the Dark Valley?
At the base. Borov is in charge there. The documents are likely in his safe.
I'll take the job.
General, I have the documents.
Let me see... Yes, this is it. Good job, stalker. You have proven your loyalty. Here is your reward.
General, is there any more work?

There is one delicate matter. A stalker named Prince owes us a lot. But the problem is, he disappeared. Rumor has it he went to the Radar. He had a unique weapon with him - a modified Winchester. I want that weapon. Find Prince, or his body, and bring me the gun.
Understood. I'll search.
Here is the Winchester, General.
Excellent weapon! A pity about Prince, he was a good fighter once... Here, take this money.
Hello, Colonel.
Greetings, stalker. Came to trade or just looking?
I want to trade.
Look at the goods. We have the best equipment in the Zone.
Colonel, do you have any tasks?
There is one thing. I need a "Goldfish" artifact. But not a simple one, a special one. It was seen in the Dark Valley, near the fuel tanks. Bring it, and I'll give you a good suit.
I'll try to find it.
Here is the "Goldfish", Colonel.
Great! As promised, here is a PSZ-9d suit. It will serve you well.
Colonel, interested in an exchange? %c[orange][Barter]
Depends on what you offer. I need medkits and ammo.
I have artifacts.
I have mutant parts.
For a "Soul" artifact I will give 3 army medkits.
For a "Mica" artifact I will give 5 packs of 9x39 ammo.
For 5 bloodsucker tentacles I will give a scientific medkit.
For 10 dog tails I will give 2 packs of buckshot.
Deal.
I'll pass for now.
Hey you, come here.
What do you want?
I'm Ivancov. The General asked me to keep an eye on you. Don't cause trouble, understood?
Understood, Captain.
Captain Ivancov, help is needed.
What happened?
Mutants attacked the checkpoint. We need support.
I'll send a squad immediately.
Greetings, stalker.
Who are you?
I am Count. A free shooter, like you. But I prefer to work alone.
Count, do you know anything about the Prince?
Prince? Yes, I knew him. A reckless guy. He went to the Radar and didn't come back. If you're looking for him, look near the helicopter crash site.
Thanks for the info.
Well, Lukash, the job is done.
Yes, we worked gloriously! You really are a master, you know your stuff.
Well, what about the payment?

Well, that goes without saying, I promised. By the way, Strelok, I look at you... you don't look like the other vagrants who roam the Zone in search of profit... You have a different "fire" in your eyes. What are you doing in the Zone, if it's not a secret, of course?

You are right, I am not here for profit. I am looking for my brother. We got lost under very strange and inexplicable circumstances. So I am trying to find my brother's trail. Or maybe, if I'm lucky, him himself. Have you heard anything about a man nicknamed "Captain", who went to the Sarcophagus with a group of other stalkers two years and a bit ago?

No, I don't know such a stalker personally. I heard about that raid into the "heart" of the Zone, of course, like everyone else. But I can't say anything more. So don't blame me. Alright, here, take your reward.
Thank you anyway, Lukash. Come on, give me what you prepared for me.
Halt.
Greetings.
Listen, man, this territory is ours and you can't pass for free.
How much?
2000 for a one-time pass through our territory.
Damn, left my checkbook at home.
Here.

There, I see immediately - a business man. When you go back, towards the exit, or want to come to us again, don't forget to come to me! And I'll tell you if you need to pay again or not. Knyaz is the boss here. Whatever he says, goes. But for now, don't even poke your nose without the dough!
Hello.
Greetings, I have a business proposal for you.
What kind of proposal?
I buy PDAs of dead stalkers.
Why do you need them?

Well, I am an Informer, so I must know as much as possible, the profession obliges. Listen, for 10 PDAs I will give you one modified artifact. Well, and if you bring 20 PDAs, I will share information about a stash with you. True, it's luck here: if it's a master's stash, the loot is corresponding. But if it's a rookie's... you understand yourself what awaits you there.
Alright, if I have PDAs - I will bring them.
Hello, how is life, rumor trader?
Well, not only rumors, let's get to business, what did you bring?
Here, gathered 10 PDAs for you.
I have a rich catch today. Here are 20 PDAs.
Up to my neck in business, no time to collect PDAs, I'll bring them next time.
Well since you brought 10 PDAs, here, take this, as promised.
20 PDAs - that's so much information! Give me your PDA, I'll send you information about a stash.
Well then, until next time.
Borov, I want to buy something. %c[orange][Barter]
I have ammo and weapons.
Ammo.
Weapons.
What ammo?
I have Saiga and AKMN.
For AKM, standard.
7.62x39mm, 3 packs for 5 cans of food.
For AKM, armor-piercing.
7.62x39mm armor-piercing, 3 packs for 4 bottles of vodka.
For Kalash, standard.
5.45x39mm 3 packs, for 5 loaves of bread.
For Kalash, improved.
5.45x39mm BP, 3 packs for 4 bottles of vodka.
For LR-300, standard.
5.56x45mm SS109, 3 packs for 5 sticks of sausage.
For LR-300, improved.
5.56x45mm AP, 3 packs for 4 bottles of vodka.
For SVD, standard.
7.62x54R 7N1, three packs for 1 "Stone Flower" artifact.
For Vintorez, Val or Groza, standard.
9x39 PAB-9, three packs for 1 "Slug" artifact.
AKMN.
AKMN - for 2 "Mica" artifacts.
Saiga.
Saiga - for 2 "Meat Chunk" artifacts.
AKMN is my favorite weapon, give it here.
Here, take it.
Too expensive.
Saiga? That's it, snorks, watch out! Here, take 2 "Chunks".
Nah, not today, I'm empty.
Give me standard, I guess.
I ate the canned food, I was hungry.
For AKM - armor-piercing? Give me.
Don't have it.
Give me standard, I have a Kalash but running low on ammo.
Don't have it, gave it all to crows.
Armor-piercing? Give me.
Don't have it, we partied a bit in the village yesterday.
Need for LR-300.
Ran out.
NATO ones, and armor-piercing too? Give me.
Yeah, everyone needs vodka, I don't have it - ran out.
Give me, I happen to have a "Stone Flower" with me.
Yeah, everyone needs vodka, don't have it - ran out.
Just for Groza, give me.
Don't have it, I'm broke today.
Greetings.
What brought you to me, Stalker?
Lukash told me that you can show me how to get from here, the Army Warehouses territory, to the Bar.

Yes, I can show the path to the Bar, but only if you help me too. You came just in time. There is an urgent matter: at that base you and the Freedomers captured from the military, there should be some documents left after them. I won't say exactly where, but definitely on the territory of the base. If Freedomers find them before you... In short, I wouldn't want Lukash's people to find these documents. Let's say, for ethical reasons.
Need to find some documents at the Freedom base. Do I understand you correctly?
Exactly. Find the documents, and I'll show you how to get to the Bar for that.
And how do you imagine that? There are piles of these documents there, my whole life will go into searching for them. And I need to go further.

Wait, brother, don't get excited. This folder is special, I assure you. It is probably hidden, but not among other documents, (lowering voice heavily, whispering) on the folder should be written: agents and case number. And also, this folder is in a protective, waterproof and fireproof transparent cover. So it can lie anywhere, even under the open sky. Got it? I very... very much desire to receive it, stalker. So, besides the transition to the "Bar", I'll throw in an artifact transmutation recipe for you.
Well alright, deal. I'll try to find this secret folder at the Freedom base, I have nowhere else to go, need to get out of the Warehouses somehow.
Greetings, I was at the base.
Well, what's there? Found it?

Yes, found it. Interesting folder. I peeked in there out of the corner of my eye and found something very important for myself... I didn't come here just for nothing. I am looking for a brother, with whom we parted ways quite a long time ago. His nickname is Captain. In that secret folder I found a mention of him. And these records are quite fresh. At most half a year old, judging by some dates. Do you know anything about this man?

Actually, sticking your nose into other people's papers is somewhat indecent. But okay, let it pass. And regarding your Captain: consider that you already found him. He recently joined the Duty faction, serves as a guide for them, he is a seasoned stalker after all, crawled the Zone far and wide in his time. So I wish you to find him as soon as possible. That's the situation. Hope I helped you.
This is the best news for all the time I've been in the Zone! Thank you so much for such important information about my brother. And where should I look for this Duty faction?

As far as I know, Dutyers have now settled in the Dark Valley. So you will get there exactly through the Bar territory. True, then you'll have to pass through the Garbage, but that's trifles. And now I will mark the transition to the Bar territory on your PDA and, as promised, give you a transmutation recipe, will come in handy.
Thank you, you truly are the "Information Service" of the Zone. Maybe you can advise something else useful?

Well, okay, I'll give you one piece of valuable information for free. A man lives in the Zone in a tunnel at Agroprom - Sorcerer. He practices "black magic". And the most interesting thing is that he can resurrect the dead. So if you suddenly need to bring someone back to life, look for the Sorcerer at Agroprom.
Well, thanks for the info! I hope I won't have to use "black magic" services.
Can I do anything else for you?
Yes, you can. There is another urgent matter. Diggers on the Radar are in trouble. Someone robbed their stash. Now they are sitting there completely without food and without medicines.
What is required of me?

It's quite simple really. I will collect what they need. It will be enough for the start. Your task is to take the package to them. I'll send you the group's coordinates. At the same time, I'll show you the transition from the Army Warehouses to the Radar. Might come in handy later.

Alright, send the coordinates, and I'm off. Need to hurry. I'll go to the Radar to help the guys. At the same time, I'll collect some artifacts for myself on the way. They say there are many of them there, like a "Klondike". Well, and after that I'll rush to the Bar. Maybe I'll manage to rest a bit there. And then I'll go meet the Dutyers and hope to meet my brother there.
Who did this to you?

Better not ask. I've seen things, but this... A bloodsucker, but so powerful. We shot at it from six barrels, but it didn't care. Good thing it was full, didn't kill us - just tormented us a little. That bastard! What the Zone does to them, these aren't monsters, but some kind of terminators... Anyway, what are you doing here, stalker?

Ah, yes, completely forgot. I am here on behalf of the Informer. He collected some things for you here. Says you were robbed the other day. Well, there's a little: food, medkits, vodka. And generally, I am looking for a brother in the Zone, they call him "Captain". We got lost a long time ago. Have you heard anything about a stalker nicknamed "Captain" and his team?

No, I haven't heard of such a stalker, so sorry... And thank you. You helped us out greatly. How can I thank you? Ah, here, there is something! Take this, we found someone's weapon stash here, got hold of some ammo. Which ones should I give you? NATO or ours?
Give me NATO ones.
Give me ours.
Well, since I wandered into such a wilderness, maybe there is a job for me?
How about hunting?
Is it for that bloodsucker that almost tore you to shreds?
For him, the darling! Or are you afraid? I want to make a stuffed trophy out of him for memory.
No, I'm not afraid. Where do I look for him?
He hangs around here, not far. Let me drop a marker on him for you. Kill the beast - drag the carcass of this mutated cattle to me.
D-damn! What a beast. Barely managed.
Exactly, that's what I'm saying. How did you handle him? I still don't understand.
Yeah, had to tinker with it. Anyway, here is the carcass, accept the work.
A huge buffalo. And it stinks, the bastard. Well okay. Here, take a few medkits.
What next?
I think we need to catch that bastard who stole things from our stash.
How?

Very simple. Look, I put a little loot in our stash, and you, when you get there, hide nearby. Since there is no one to steal but our own, I will gather all my people and tell them about this stash. Since the "Rat" is among us, he will surely go stealing again, and there... there I rely on you, brother.
Sviblov, I won't let you down.

Just this, don't fire prematurely there. Wait until he reaches the stash, otherwise who knows, maybe a person is just walking. And don't catch his eye, understand yourself, it's a delicate matter. We don't need noise.
Greetings to you, Sviblov.
Oh, our savior! By the way, what is your name?
My name is Strelok.
Strelok, so be it Strelok. How is our business?
Handled everything quietly. Certain Fedya the Robber.

Ah, you devil! I suspected him too, but there was no proof. Alright, thank you for the service. Yes, here is your reward - a sniper rifle. The guys dug it up somewhere. Look, a good thing. I'll give you a pack of sniper ammo too.
Thanks for the carbine! Yes, by the way, I took some ancient Amulet from the neck of this Fedya the Robber. A very strange thing, I want to tell you. Here, look... Do you know what this thing is?

Yes, a curious little thing... It emits some radiation, but clearly has some protective property. You know what? Show this Amulet to the Wanderer. He is standing over there by the wall, recently returned from a raid. He surely knows what kind of thing this is.
Okay, give me my reward and I'll go show the Amulet to the Wanderer.
Well Sviblov, is there more work, otherwise I'm leaving.
There is, of course, where would we be without work. Will need to go down into the Bunker and drag from there... Yes, basically, drag everything that can be dragged.
M-m-m, the task is a bit vague. Can you clarify what exactly, otherwise maybe tables and chairs are needed too.
Ideally, all we need is the system unit from the computer. But... but possibly, there will also be some paper documents. So, if there are any, drag them here too.
Understood everything, executing already.
Well, Sviblov, you found a place to send me! There are monsters like cockroaches and just as many mercenaries, how did they even pass by you?
They probably found some other entrance, considering it's a laboratory. These are very important documents. Did you find them?
Yes, here is the system unit, and here are the documents.
Well done! For this I'll throw you a transmutation recipe. My guys took this recipe from one mercenary's PDA.
Lukash, how about work?
Work? Well, there is no work for now, but there is a request.
What request?
Need to find one person.
Kill him, you mean?

You misunderstood me. There is one person, Lefty, a jack of all trades. We recaptured the base from the military. There is a lot of work: paint there, hammer here, saw more. Well, you understand yourself. I worry Dutyers might lure him to themselves.
Dutyers? And who is that?
Ah, soldiers with a delusional idea - "to cleanse the Zone". Well, let's not talk about them. Find Lefty and persuade him. I need him.
Alright. If I find Lefty, I'll try to negotiate.

I won't be in debt either. You see, I pay well for work. Yes, and one more thing: here on the "Army Warehouses" territory, in the village not far from the abandoned checkpoint, there is a person. Called the Informer. A shady type. You be careful with him, but you'll have to go to him. To leave the "Army Warehouses" territory you need to know where the transition is located. As far as I know, right now you can only get to the Bar from the Warehouses, but only the Informer knows the way there. So, go to him.
Understood, I'll go talk to the Informer.
Hello. Are you Lefty?
Yes, that's me.
They say you are a jack of all trades?
Well, I can do a lot of things. And what did you want?
I have a request from one person. He would like you to come to his base. And, well, various repairs there. In short, everything you know how to do.
Nah, I won't set foot near Voronin anymore. Subordination, discipline, br-r-r. Screw it, I'd better live free.
No, no. Not to Voronin, but to Lukash.

Ah, well I can go to Freedomers. But how will I go to them? Look at me, all in rags, no normal weapon, and the path is not short. Basically like this. Bring me a "Groza" and a suit. For example, here, "Mercenary Scientific Suit". A good suit, better than "Seva". Naturally, everything must be new. And then, consider it a deal.
Eh, damn, why did I get involved with you? Well okay, I'll look for a new "Mercenary Scientific Suit" and a new "Groza" for you.
Well, Lefty, hello.
Hello to you too. Well, found the new gear for me?
Yes, found it. Here, take everything as you asked: "Mercenary Scientific Suit" and "Groza" - everything in excellent condition.
Well, man, thank you! If you need anything repaired, come to me immediately.
Alright, agreed. Good luck to you!
Hello, Lukash.
Oh, Strelok, come in. How will you please me?
I found Lefty. He, of course, was a bit stubborn, but in the end agreed. So, expect guests.
You didn't let me down, as always. Thank you. My treat, as we agreed. Yes, by the way, Skinflint has a matter for you. Definitely visit him later.
Alright, I'll go visit Skinflint.
What do you want?
Brother, help me out.
Explain properly. What do you need?
Bandits grabbed my pals and are holding them in the local prison.
Is there a prison here?
Well, sort of. They simply converted an old bunker into a prison and put everyone who owes them in there.
Well, how can I help? Give you money or what?

You see, the local boss, Knyaz, doesn't want to talk to me, I'm just a pawn to him. But you, immediately visible, are a solid man. He will definitely talk to you. Help free the guys, persuade Knyaz to let them go. And I... and I will give you a transmutation recipe.
Alright, I'll talk to Knyaz, but I promise nothing.
Hello to the gang.
Greetings, fraer. Where did you pop up from? To chat or strictly for business?
Came from afar. I have business with you, no time for chatting.
Well, come on, spill it, what business do you have.
They say you are holding a couple of stalkers for debts in your prison?
So-o-o, Sakhatiy is involved again. Damn! He already buzzed all my ears off, I should kick him out of the camp territory completely. Sick of him already, for real.
Well, so what about the guys?

They are shameful bitches! They stole my personal unique shotgun. Lefty gave it to me for my birthday. I went against a pseudogiant alone with it... And these rats... The matter was like this: I drop into the bar, and put the gun on the counter so it doesn't get in the way, because I know: everyone here is one of us, they won't touch it. And I went into the rest room. Snoozed for an hour or two, went out into the hall, there were only a couple of my guys and Borov. Looked, and the gun is gone! For real GONE! Well, naturally, I started an investigation, this and that, hit my own guys, scolded Borov. It turned out in the end that these two bastards entered the bar shortly before that. \n\nSo I organized a chase after them. Caught them. Started to crack them. These devils decided to play innocent: "Us? Never, Knyaz! We respect you, life is dearer to us!". Well, in general, same old story, damn. Well, my guys conducted educational work, but all they managed to beat out of them is that they saw one ugly mug of bandit appearance, who flew out of the bar like a bullet and almost knocked them off their feet. Look at that - "bandit appearance", everyone here has bandit appearance (laughs). So I had to put them in jail. I told them this: Until they confess and return the gun plus a penalty, they sure as hell won't get out of there.
If I find the gun for you, will you let the guys go?
The gun and the penalty. Let's say, fifteen grand.
Ten thousand and the gun, can't do more.
Alright, deal, fraer. Hope your words are worth something. And press Sakhatiy. He, the sly mug, clearly didn't tell you everything.
Well? Do you want me to help you?
Of course. Why would I ask you then?
Well, then stop feeding me bullshit and tell everything as it was.

You see, someone stole Knyaz's shotgun, and Cat and Vovan were in the bar at about that time. Well, now everyone thinks it's them. Especially since everyone knows that Cat is an avid gambler and constantly loses. He owes half the bar already. Agree, with such a reputation it is not difficult to suspect him? Only it's not him.
Then who?
The guys, when they entered the bar, saw a man. They met him and he almost knocked them down. They suspect him.
And where am I supposed to look for the man who almost knocked them down?

In short, here is what I will tell you: when Cat and Vovan were being led to prison, and I walked nearby and heard briefly from the bandits that the man is from Kocherga's gang, his nickname is Nut. He and two others, well the very same ones who led the guys, went for very rare and valuable artifacts. They said that somewhere in a secluded corner a strange phenomenon happened. All known anomalies formed in one place, and a monstrous haze raged for three days. And imagine, about a dozen rarest artifacts formed there after that. \n\nThey were cooked in this very mess. Where this place is, I didn't hear clearly, but it was definitely said that somewhere in the Dark Valley. And that the artifacts that formed there appear and disappear, as if falling through the ground. And whoever is lucky will be able to find and collect them. So, these three decided to hit the jackpot and went there on luck. But there were so many monsters in that place, oh boy! Well, then those two pissed themselves and ran away. And Nut, as he saw the arts, blew his top. He went straight ahead. But managed to take only one art, then chimeras tore him up badly. Well, he also ran away then. Ran for a long time, but still couldn't get away... Was wounded badly.
Why did you keep silent before?
I wasn't silent, but no one wanted to listen to me.
So, alright, everything is clear with this. You better tell me, where should I look for Knyaz's personal shotgun now?

Don't get hot! I think Knyaz's gun lies where chimeras finished Nut off. After all, beasts don't need weapons... And the bandits just said that the matter was in the Dark Valley. And that dude ran to a small two-story building, which is at the gas station next to the unfinished factory building. He tried to hide in it, but not fate, apparently... There, in the house at the gas station, you should search.
Well, Knyaz? I found your personal shotgun.
And the money, did you bring the money?
Yes, money is with me.
No, no money.
Clean work! That hits the spot, damn! You greased me well, bro! Alright, I'll tell my guys to release those two bastards.
Well, are you satisfied? I found Knyaz's gun.
Thank you, you helped out. And the guys? Will the guys be released?
Yes, Knyaz already gave the order.
Well, I... Well... Here, write down the recipe. Thank you again.
What did you want?

Man, need your help. Mercenaries captured our brother Lefty. There are only six of us, and heaps of them. Every gun is important to us now. Help out, brother, come with us. We won't let our comrade be hurt.
Oh, Lefty! He is exactly who I need.
Follow us.
Understood everything.
Bes, can you spare some ammo?
I can give some for the Kalash.
Well, give me at least for the Kalash. I spent all mine on these scums.
What was that?

Bandits, marauders, damn them. We declared war on them here, cleared almost the entire Dark Valley of them, otherwise they didn't let anyone pass. Well, in revenge they decided to cover us all at once. Alright, we'll show them who's the boss in the house.
Understood. You chose a not entirely successful place for a base.
Well, we are a relatively young faction... Just wait, we'll gain strength and take the Bar. It's high time to kick the bandits out of there.
You'll have a hard time. They are entrenched there painfully well.
Give it time, and we will be there. I, General Voronin, promise you this. By the way, thanks for the help. Here, take this from me, will come in handy.
Health to you, Comrade Colonel. %c[orange][Barter]
Greetings, stalker, what did you want?
Well, want to buy something.
There are ammo, medkits and weapons.
Ammo.
Weapons.
Medkits.
What ammo?
What weapons?
I have army ones.
Ammo 5.45x39mm BP, armor-piercing.
3 packs - for "Jellyfish" artifact.
I have a "Jellyfish" - here.
Oh well.
Ammo 7.62x54R 7N1, sniper.
3 packs - for "Meat Chunk" artifact.
Give me, the sniper rifle is idle in the backpack.
Nah, don't have it.
Ammo 7.62x54R 7N14, armor-piercing.
3 packs - for "Flash" artifact.
Give me armor-piercing - just the thing.
Nah, don't have a "Flash".
Ammo 9x39 SP-5, sniper.
3 packs - for "Gravi" artifact.
Give me, just the thing for Groza.
Where will I get you a "Gravi"?
Ammo 9x39 SP-6, armor-piercing.
3 packs - for 2 "Sparkler" artifacts.
Give me, I just happen to have 2 "Sparkler" artifacts with me.
You went too far.
AN-94 "Abakan".
AN-94 "Abakan" - for 2 "Gravi" artifacts.
Give me, I just happen to have 2 "Gravi" artifacts with me.
You went too far.
Assault "Abakan".
Assault "Abakan" - for 2 "Urchin" artifacts.
Give me, I just happen to have 2 "Urchin" artifacts with me.
Prices! Prices! I better run with a Kalash.
Kalashnikov Machine Gun.
Kalashnikov Machine Gun - for 2 "Ruby Spring" artifacts.
Give me, I just happen to have two "Ruby Springs" with me.
Didn't need it anyway, just asking.
VSS "Vintorez".
VSS "Vintorez" - for 2 "Ruby Battery" artifacts.
Give me, I just happen to have a couple of "Ruby Batteries" with me.
Didn't need it anyway, just asking.
RPG-7V.
RPG-7V - for 2 "Stone Flower" artifacts.
Give me, I just happen to have two "Stone Flower" artifacts with me.
Too expensive.
How much for army ones?
3 army medkits - for one "Slug" artifact.
Give me, I just happen to have one "Slug" artifact with me.
Too expensive.
Is there work, Knyaz?
What, fraer, not scared to work with us? You understand yourself, our work is "special", mostly by the concepts.
I understand, spill it.
Here is a task for you, simple for starters: There is one fraer, called Jeka. So he owes us money, shameful nit. He is hanging around somewhere at the Garbage now.
What needs to be done?
Two options: either let him cough up the dough, the little bitch, 15 grand, or... you understand.
Alright, I'll talk to him.
Are you Jeka?
Well, it's me. What did you want?
I am from Knyaz. Do you guess what the conversation will be about?
He's fed me up. I told him: "Wait a bit, business is about to get better." And now the Garbage is practically empty. Broke in a word, sitting without work.
Knyaz won't be satisfied with such an answer.
Well what do you want? Here, kill me... But money won't fall into his pocket from that... Or listen, there is one option...
What are you talking about?
I can offer one thing: this... this is a map fragment. If you assemble it completely, you will find out the location of Semetsky's stash itself.
You are pushing bullshit on me. Why do I need this piece of paper?

No, I know what I'm saying. One old digger gave it to me, don't remember the name. We waited out a blowout with him. I waited it out, but he... but he didn't. He reached the Sarcophagus together with Semetsky. Their group formed just of eight people plus Semetsky. And further he went alone. Said, if he returns alive, he will show the way to the rest. And finally took out a map where his stash is marked and divided into eight different parts. And distributed to everyone present. Either as a keepsake, or for some other reason, I don't recall now...
And what do you propose?
Well, I give You the map piece, and you pay off the debt for me.
You are probably lying... Eh, sink or swim, give me the map piece.
No, brother, you won't fool me!
Hello, Knyaz.
And health to you, how will you please me?
That Jeka tried to scam me. Had to shoot him. Especially since he wasn't going to return the debt anyway.
Eh. Immediately visible, fraer, couldn't scam people for money. Well okay. Here, take this.
Hello, Knyaz.
Hello, well how is our business?
Everything is right. He paid up.
Well, then cough up the dough.
Here, take it.
Oh damn, I lost my wallet at the Garbage. Wait, I'll be there and back in a flash.
Well done, fraer! Worked normally. And here is a small present from me for the work.
Work some more? By the way, my name is Strelok.

There is a little business, Strelok. On one hand easy, on the other... In short, a bag of weed was dropped for us here. You understand, not hay. It was before the blowout, and the Zone before a blowout behaves damn inhospitably. The helicopter itself almost crashed. The wind was blowing - oh boy, and the pilots got pretty sick, so they had to drop the bag wherever they could. The only thing they could say is that there was a tower nearby, a water tower. I sent my fraers to search, but they didn't find jack... So consider the tower your only landmark.
Some landmark. That's, consider, several kilometers. Crawl on my belly?
Yeah, a problem... Listen here. You can also go to the nerds at Yantar. Those eggheads can surely help you. Ask them to put a marker on the bag of weed.
Alright, let's see. If I don't find it myself, I'll go bow to the scientists.
Greetings, Respectable one.
Hello to you too, stalker. Hiding from monsters or came for business?
Well, essentially, for business.
Well, spill it.
I need to hang a marker on one little thing.
What thing? Speak clearer.
A bag of weed. Marijuana, most likely, is in there...
Wow, valuable goods! I don't even ask where from... We'll hang a marker, no problem, but you understand yourself...
How much?
